Title: Child maltreatment
Source: Rutter's Child and Adolesc. Psychiatry: Sixth Ed.
Abstract: © 2015 by JohnWiley & Sons, Ltd. All rights reserved.Child maltreatment is a worldwide phenomenon that is still often under-recognised. This Chapter primarily covers physical and emotional maltreatment, and neglect; sexual abuse is specifically addressed in a separate chapter. Such abuse experiences are usually associated with marked distress, impairments in mental health, social and academic functioning. There are also physical changes including alterations in brain structure and an impact of chronic stress on inflammatory responses associated with physical health impairments. Awareness of such physical effects further adds to the importance of prompt recognition of maltreatment, effective treatment of its sequelae, and above all primary prevention. There are modest but encouraging findings emerging at each of these levels of intervention.
